intro: Thalictrum chelidonii, commonly known as the meadow rue, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate, compound leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, which are clustered in upright, branched inflorescences. Thalictrum chelidonii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
